result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoinette M. Gaddo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay Costs - victim witness surcharge, domestic abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge. 
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. 
Defendant to participate and comply with the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program geared towards women - needs to be approved by agent.
Pay Costs - victim witness surcharge, domestic abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge.
If there is restitution will need to be paid within 60 days.

timeConds.notes: Community service with the Portage County Parks Department on the Green Circle Trail or Campgrounds.

miscConds.notes:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1.
No domestic abuse surcharge on Count 2.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antoinette M. Gaddo in court with attorney Karl A Schmidt. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:42 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Isherwood states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - guilty
Count 2 - guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Defendant informed of voting rights and having to sign a form; not able to possess firearms.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on both counts.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Parties are ready to proceed to sentencing.
Court asks if any victims were notified of today's hearing.
The State informs the Court that victims were notified. but are not present in the courtroom.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Attorney for Defendant concurs regarding sentencing recommendations.
Court asks the Defendant if he/she wants to make any statements.
Defendant makes statements regarding her sentencing.
Atty Isherwood makes statements regarding jail time that defendant had, which was 3 days in jail.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Imposed/stayed sentence jail sentence, 90 day.
12 months probation
25 hours community service with the Portage County Parks Department on the Green Circle Trail or Campgrounds.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. 
Defendant to participate and comply with the Domestic Abuse Alternative Program geared towards women - needs to be approved by agent.
Pay Costs - victim witness surcharge, domestic abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge.
If there is restitution will need to be paid within 60 days.

Count 2 - 
6 month concurrent jail sentence Imposed/Stayed.
12 months probation
comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
no domestic abuse surcharge
pay costs - Victim Witness Surcharge, DNA Surcharge
3 days credit for jail

Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department only if probation is revoked.
Status conference on May 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on July 8, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antoinette M. Gaddo in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt. Veronica Fay Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:01 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Isherwood states appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Antoinette M. Gaddo in court with attorney Anne Renc. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
